intro_text: p_l takes the apprentices out at dusk, setting the atmosphere for a fun story.
decline_text: They're stopped - the camp has need of a little more work, this will have to wait for another night.

success_outcomes.text: On the brightest night of leafbare, under a full, piercing, blue moon, a great serpent will rise from the centre of the swamp, banishing fangs dripping poison and a scaled pelt thicker than a monster. The apprentices shiver as p_l builds the image. It will rear up, higher than the tallest tree, no, twice as high, and bite the moon, swallowing it whole!

fail_outcomes.text: The apprentices are inattentive and twitchy. p_l lets them go before {PRONOUN/p_l/subject} really start the story. {PRONOUN/p_l/subject/CAP}{VERB/p_l/'re/'s} not going to waste {PRONOUN/p_l/poss} time on an unappreciative audience.
